title: Love Microsoft
text:
I love all there software, I‚Äôve been working with it for 20 years.  Thanks MICROSOFT

Sheryl

title: UI is odd
text: It‚Äôs an alright system, but honestly I‚Äôd just choose Gmail. For some reason, load times are just longer, the UI for mobile makes less sense. Sometimes I‚Äôll get random notifications that don‚Äôt actually come from any emails. It‚Äôs not worth it unless your work or school uses it. Just go with gmail.

title: Good app with two staggering flaws
text:
1. Every 2-3 months, the app goes back to displaying a notification ‚Äúopen outlook to view message‚Äù when I receive a new email. This is completely unacceptable when the only solution is to delete and redownload the app. 

2. No ability to schedule send emails from app. Have to use online version. How is something so simple missing from outlook.

title: A surprisingly good email client.
text:
Search is better than it was, and has strong integration with organization-wide Office and email. 

Nifty adoption of select mark down attributes for fast composing, and pretty good integration of voice for going through and responding to email when you don‚Äôt feel like using the keyboard.

title: Mostly Good
text: Outlook on my iPhone is pretty useful except that i periodically cannot find emails I know are there. Also, the junk and blocking functions appear to be completely useless. I even get emails with the offer to unblock the blocked sender. This is EXTREMELY frustrating and will be the reason I dump this app at some point. It wastes my time and I really don‚Äôt have the patience.

title: Save Contacts is broken yet again
text: If I enable this it duplicates all contacts in my iPhone. Microsoft, how hard is it to figure this out with Apple?

title: Msn mail to outlook
text: I‚Äôve been a client of Microsoft sense the old man mail about 5 years ago I switched to outlook and it‚Äôs been fantastic as well as there office 365 I‚Äôll probly be using it untill I‚Äôm 100 years old

title: The Workplace GO-TO!
text: I never have any issues with Outlook and it is easy to use and navigate! I get all of my work related emails right here to my mobile device, and that is important in my line of work.

title: Change to notifications?
text: All of a sudden the notifications aren‚Äôt showing anything specific about the email. Only showing ‚Äúnew email - tap to read!‚Äù Why do you guys change things that aren‚Äôt broken!

title: Great for the most part
text: With some exceptions (I‚Äôm looking at you Word), when it comes to their office products on Apple platforms, Microsoft tends to execute a few steps short of perfectly. But those short steps can be chew-through-your-workdesk-annoying. The iOS Outlook app has a solid user interface. It‚Äôs quite stable and doesn‚Äôt have a lot of bugs. When it comes to reading and composing emails, it does what it‚Äôs supposed to do. But a few (what some would see as minor) things are incredibly annoying. Why in the world can‚Äôt I customize my font when composing emails? This seems like an easy feature to provide. Why is it 2024 and we can‚Äôt get our email signatures to look the way we want them to look? And don‚Äôt get me started with trying to include images in them. Again, a few steps short of perfect. Works well, but wish they would give some more attention to those steps.

title: Better than it was
text: It continues to improve but remains cumbersome

title: Awesome

title: Outlook Review
text: Outlook is a great tool for sending emails professionally and it is connected to many other Microsoft apps which I like. The only reason I have it one star is because it doesn‚Äôt show notifications so I must constantly look in the app to see if someone has emailed me. Otherwise, I definitely recommend Outlook!

title: A review
text: Outlook is constantly updated with new features!

title: Great app for mobile, needs Vision Pro Native
text:
First and foremost, thank you for making such a great mobile experience. This is my go to app for email. It supports all of my various personal and work accounts seamlessly.

For Vision Pro, please release a native application. Currently, Outlook will not allow me to open M365 attachments in the Naive Vision Pro applications. This would be a fantastic capability.

Related, but not to Outlook, please provide access to OneDrive in either a compatibility app, or on native Vision Pro. The lack of this feature is making workflows challenging on the Vision Pro.

title: Excellent!
text: An excellent email software. Much better than my old email.

title: Excellent platform for business, organizational and personal
text: Outlook on is an excellent tech for efficient and effective communication and management of organizational businesses and personal development

title: Flexibility is Key
text: Being a permanently remote worker, having full access to Outlook on my remote devices as I do on my computer is key to my productivity.  Works well and seamless.
